required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of the Epidemic of COVID-19 Infection Among People Living With HIV (SARS-CoV-2)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Impact of the Epidemic of COVID-19 Infection Among People Living With HIV (SARS-CoV-2)

brief_summary.textblock: The non-essential and non-urgent follow-up consultations of patients living with HIV were postponed or transformed into "teleconsultation" or exchanges of e-mails between practitioners and patients during COVID-19 epidemic. This change in care can have an impact on follow-up and access to treatment for PVVIH.

detailed_description.textblock: On 16 March 2020, an instruction to postpone "non-urgent" consultations was given to doctors. Thus, the non-essential and non-urgent follow-up consultations of patients living with HIV were postponed or transformed into "teleconsultation" or exchanges of e-mails between practitioners and patients. This change in care can have an impact on follow-up and access to treatment for PVVIH. In addition, the epidemic itself may have consequences: PVVIH may be at greater risk because of their immunosuppression and associated co-morbidities.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of SARS CoV2 infection in PVVIH in Hauts de France
primary_outcome.description: Determination of the number of patients with microbiologically or clinically-biologically proven SARS CoV2 infection at inclusion in the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of SARS CoV2 infection in PVVIH in Hauts de France
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 19 months
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of the number of patients with microbiologically or clinically-biologically proven SARS CoV2 infection at the end of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Determine the incidence rate of COVID 19 among PVVIH antiretroviral treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 19 months
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients who stopped their antiretroviral treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Determine the incidence rate of COVID 19 among PVVIH discontinuing antiretroviral treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 19 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Determine the incidence rate of COVID 19 among PVVIH who stopped all follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 19 months
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients who stopped all follow-up by an infectious disease specialist

secondary_outcome.measure: Psychological consequences of this epidemic among PVVIH : HAD
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 19 months
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the psychological scales HAD on PVVIH

secondary_outcome.measure: Psychological consequences of this epidemic among PVVIH : PROQOL-HIV
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 19 months
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the psychological scales PROQOL-HIV on PVVIH

intervention.description: bi-monthly questionnaire and then one visit with questionnaire and covid-19 test

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient followed up for HIV infection in one of the COREVIH Hauts de France centres participating in the study
- Having communicated an email address
- Having given their consent to participate in this study
- Beneficiary subject affiliated or entitled to a social security scheme
Exclusion Criteria:
- Minor patient
- Refusal to participate
- Patient under guardianship
